Reviews.Title: “First visit to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Aledroos
Reviews.Content: Staff will be better if they smile once a while. On second nite no water reported to the Front Desk and was told is not their problem but city problem but there is water on other floor.

Reviews.Title: “convenient for its price, lovely area”
Reviews.Author: omarhafez
Reviews.Content: perfect location, in the heart of the old city. staff are friendly but not very fluent in english, they try though. nice breakfast buffet. room was really tiny... but convenient. good selection if you're on a budget and more of sightseeing than shopping person!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, no sea view as promised”
Reviews.Author: swazzer
Reviews.Content: It is an average hotel in a corner but pretty close to the Sultanahmet area. The refrigerator in the room was not working and they did not bother replace it. The breakfast was ok though. The room was clean and very brightly decorated. Actually, the interior feels pretty moghul. But the bathroom could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Kunefa
Reviews.Content: The double room is quite big, it is clean although furnitures and bathroom are old. The breakfast is typical Turkish and the position, close to the all major attraction is the best thing! I would recommend it if you are not too much pretentious ! I booked it 4 months in advance with a deal of 4 nights,2 pers , 103â‚¬ total!

Reviews.Title: “Location the only thing going for this place”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina S
Reviews.Content: Location was good - close to Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, etc., but there are many other hotels in this area. Room was very small, shower was terrible (low pressure and the shower head kept falling off the wall), room was noisy from the street traffic. Breakfast was okay, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “"Comfort" Hotel? - What a joke!”
Reviews.Author: HafizQayib
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a sweltering July day, with a small kid and a luggage, to find out that our room is on the third floor, there is no elevator in this "comfort" hotel, no bellboy available and a spiral staircase to boot! The receptionist, seeing the kid, immediately told me he will cost extra. When asked why, since there is no surcharge for kids on their website, he said that information is "old", but I can pay the surcharge of 15 euros per night instead of 20. He demanded I pay outright. I was in no condition to argue, but only because I was very tired and had an important meeting in an hour at another end of Istanbul. But the worst of all was the room. It was 7 square metres ( 75 square feet), together with a bathroom! Literally half of the entire space was taken by an ordinary bed. The room was so small that there was not enough space for towel hooks in the bathroom - I had to hang them on the top of the sliding door. When I asked the reception that since I pay extra for the kid, could he at least upgrade us to a larger room, I was told there are no rooms available. I tried to book into the hotel using booking.com and found that at least 4 rooms were unbooked. Overall impression: unfriendly, misleading, terrible rip-off. In fairness, Wi-Fi connection was working OK, the room was clean when we arrived and cleaned next day, and breakfast quality was on par with Turkish budget hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Inhospitable and Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: pkt63
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation with Sultan's Eye for 5 nights. On their website it clearly states in multiple places that a stay of at least 3 nights includes a free transfer from Ataturk Airport, which I requested along with the reservation. An associate emailed me back an said the transfer would be 25 Euros. I replied, pointing out their website policy and the next day a different person replied to me saying they know their website SAYS that, but in reality they are no longer offering that. Oh and by the way, now they are going to charge me 30 Euros for the transfer! Well, great. That's actually the reason we chose them over another hotel we were considering, because that's a good value. I know this isn't Ameria, but....false advertising much? Secondly, just as far as being inhospitable, the day we were leaving for the trip, my father passed away, and we could not go. Just a few hours after I was notified of his death, I diligently emailed Sultan's Eye to let them know we would not be at the airport for the pick-up and had to cancel our reservation. I never received even an email back from them, confirming they had received my email, much less that they appreciated that I went out of my way to prevent any undue burden for them of driving out to the airport, etc. And if I could take the time to do that courtesy for them while dealing with the death of my father, I would certainly think they could do me the courtesy of replying and confirming how they were going to handle my cancellation. By looking at my credit card activity, I see that they did charge us for what looks like one night's stay, which would seem to be consistent with their cancellation policy on their website (amazing!). I certainly won't fault them for actually being consistent in that regard (and we have travel insurance to help us with any financial losses like this), but clearly they don't provide even basic courtesies, much less going above and beyond. We are rescheduling our trip now, and certainly won't be staying with them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but not a brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: topkat_123
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is fantastic, very close to restaurants, shops and major attractions like the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi Palace. Staff were friendly however on my arrival I was told I had been â€˜upgradedâ€™ to the Junior Suite which happened to be on the 3rd floor (no lift!!), the receptionist did take a couple of bags then on my last suitcase he just put his hands up saying he was busy! This was at midnight and nothing was really happening so he obviously wasnâ€™t interested in a tip! So even though I was tired from my travels I had to take my own bag up 3 flights of stairs! Suite was basically a normal room with a bigger bathroom and a Jacuzzi, which after sightseeing and walking all day was nice. Did leak though and even though I reported and they claimed to have fixed I still had the same problem! Room did have dim lighting so we had to keep the bathroom light on in the evenings, I think this was being addressed as there were 2 wires sticking out of the ceiling. Room was cleaned daily. Had to keep the bathroom closed as smelt of raw sewage at times and the heating was on full blast which I had to turn down with valves on either side of the radiator. Don't rely on the Wi-Fi as signal was very poor and kept dropping, best signal was in reception area and breakfast area downstairs. Were allowed to use the Wi-Fi of Amiral Palace opposite but that wasnâ€™t much better. There was a laptop in the corner in the lobby but most of the time it was occupied. Even though breakfast advertised as on the roof terrace I think this is no more as looked like our room had been the terrace! Breakfast was basic but ok, bread, cheese, meats and spreads. Overall room was ok but having passed other rooms on my way up and down they looked very small indeed, so unless you are staying in the Suite I couldnâ€™t recommend as over Easter the rooms were not cheap! Having said that if you want decent standard accommodation you would need to pay a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional value, great central location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Rachel300111
Reviews.Content: The price for the hotel was exceptional and the room was very clean (daily housekeeping), quiet and comfortable with an ensuite bathroom, TV, tea making and extra seating area. Free wifi and breakfast (extensive buffett style perfect for setting you up for the day) was also included in the price. The staff were very friendly and helpful - even printing my online baording pass so i didnt need to find an internet cafe!!! The location was fantastic and very close to a number of local attractions (Haggia Sofia, Blue Mosque etc) but was also in a quieter area away from the noise. I would highly recommend this hotel and when I visit Turkey off season again will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Sultan's Eye”
Reviews.Author: angelacustode
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a very good condition. Rooms are clean, food in good too. Maintenance personnel is responsible and respectful towards guests. Location is close to the market and beautiful mosque. Ive spent only 2 days, and i think next time i will be in Turkey i chose the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “True to it's name!”
Reviews.Author: ransed331
Reviews.Content: It was a really comfortable and cool place. The staff was very friendly and really nice. I did not feel myself stranger after first five minutes. Breakfast choice was healthy and abundant. The room was spacious and beautiful with modern look. Bath was clean and fragrant. Wifi was working at best speed. It is close to major city attractions and public transport. There are many restaurants at walking distance. I will highly recomend to all.

Reviews.Title: “The right price for your basic needs”
Reviews.Author: dwhitebsc
Reviews.Content: It is a budget price hotel so expect a very small room. However, if you just need a place to sleep and shower then the size of the room is somewhat irrelevant. But, you have your own loo and hot water comes out of the shower (eventually). Compared to the nearest cheaper options this was excellent value for money. Otherwise for the same price you will end up in a dorm in a hostel. It had a tele so you can see what Turkish tele looks like. There was free Wi-fi which worked well with my mobile phone allowing me to check-in for my return flight on line and research some places to visit. Very friendly and helpfull staff - I was a wanderer so didn't need them to arrange anythinig; but they would have happily done so. They even throw in a very decent contintal breakfast. The location is also perfect. For the price I simply can't complain about anything - and that is very unusal for me! I had read a couple of bad reviews about the hotel elsewhere but were few in number with most being very positive. Those previous bad reviews should be ignored. Compare the price to any other basic hotel to understand. And I bet the more expensive places are perhaps worse with fewer facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Bahar_z
Reviews.Content: A beautiful and clean hotel with nice staff. We staid at Sultan's eye Hotel for two nights and it was perfect and the hotel rates was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home for a stranger in the city”
Reviews.Author: pakistanitraveller
Reviews.Content: from start to end, the experience was incredible. awesome staff, location in proximity to the blue mosque and room decor etc...highly recommended and incredible value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: guietcry
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from 3 nights at the Sultans Eye Hotel in Istanbul. The hotel was in a perfect location for the Blue and Ayasofya mosques and the Topkapi Palace. It was a very pretty part of town and an easy walk to the river and all the other interesting places to visit. The hotel was extremely clean with very friendly staff. A lovely buffet style breakfast with home made cakes. Only 11 rooms which made a very quiet and friendly stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RachidMtougui
Reviews.Content: My stay at Sultan's Eye Comfort Hotel was a wonderful experience. My first meeting with the hotel staff made me forget the trip tiredness. They are very friendly and helpful. I had the chance of staying in 5 stars hotels, but I never felt the same warmth and happiness I felt in Sultan's Eye Comfort Hotel. It was like staying with a small family. I hope I get the chance to return there one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, service, and location.”
Reviews.Author: girl59_10
Reviews.Content: Sultan's Eye Comfort Hotel was excellent for our 6 days in Istanbul. They had a van waiting for us when we arrived very late at night at the airport, and they arranged transportation for us back to the airport. The staff was very accomodating in every respect. The hotel is in an excellent location, just a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. There was a computer to check emails, breakfast was good, and the beds were firm. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience, ever. AVOID AT ALL COST!”
Reviews.Author: transience
Reviews.Content: Our booking was not acknowledged and the hotel manager was extremely rude to us. (he yelled) Asked for 10 TL when we asked to borrow the hotel's phone to call for help. We had to look for alternative accommodation in the middle of the night. All very ridiculous and is a real SHAME to the Turkish tourism industry.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: ithambo
Reviews.Content: Cozy comfortable rooms decorated in Istanbul kitsch style. Hasan the manager was very helpful and pleasant. Great location close to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. Breakfast was simple but satisfying, and the view of the water every morning was great.

Reviews.Title: “Small and quÄ±et hotel.”
Reviews.Author: risbiz
Reviews.Content: ThÄ±s hotel was very small and quÄ±et, good for a relaxÄ±ng holÄ±day. Very comfortable and great servÄ±ce. FrÄ±endly and helpful staff. There Ä±s a terrace wÄ±th an amazÄ±ng vÄ±ew for breakfast. I would reccomnd thÄ±s hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel, updated room, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelM00se
Reviews.Content: Our room was newly decorated, with a lovely, newly-tiled bath. The room was quiet and clean, and the beds were comfortable. The terrace above the hotel has nice views of the Sea of Marmara and a partial view of the Blue Mosque. The breakfast was simple but nice. The staff was very nice. The location is central to sites in Sultanahmet. It's a bit down a side street, but still close to all of the things you would want to see and only 2 blocks from the main restaurant area.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a perfect starting point for a short trip in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: vodi1
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our trip to Istanbul and we believe this is to some parts thanks to the very nice personnel in the Sultans Eye. They have been helpful with any question we came up with and fulfilled any wish. The rooms have been clean and good for some days stay. Only the breakfast could have been bigger - all the basics have been there, but e.g. fruit or different kinds of yoghurt could have been nice. However, we then got it just around the corner on the way to the city! Thanks to the great staff there! Best wishes!

Reviews.Title: “good if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: thebaroness
Reviews.Content: great location for energetic types that want to enjoy the local culture. great restaurants 2 mins walk away. breakfast a bit bland but can't complain as so reasonable room very clean nice bedding and towels, small flat screen tv, plenty of hot water and kettle in room for tea and coffee was a bonus . street outside could be noisy but we did have the windows open. hotel staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “One of the WORST Hotels ever...not your place if you have allergies”
Reviews.Author: nukem7945
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a trip to Istanbul and stayed in this so called "hotel". The rooms are dusty and towels were not changed for the duration of the whole stay (4 nights). The rooms at the first floor smell of cats. One of my friend is allergic to cats and experienced an allergic reaction. The breakfast is mediocre...just some cheap salami and processed chease. The hotel is located to al major tourist attraction in Sultanahmet but there are plenty of other hotels and even hostels around that offer better service and rates. Oh and by the way...they don't accept credit cards...be ready to rush to the nearest bank to get cash so that you can pay for the hotel. I honestly advise anyone wishing to spend some time in Istanbul to look anywhere else for a hotel

Reviews.Title: “poor service and very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: ttravel_lisa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel few days ago and I really didnt like it. I do not recommend this hotel to the people who is looking comfort in Istanbul.It is also very expensive.I was charged 105 lira a night. Bed and room is very small.I am not really big person but bed was very small for 2 people. Bathrooms are dirty and breakfast is horribble. Location is good and it is close by main sights. All in all, Sultan eye comfort hotel is bad choice for great hotel expectation.I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Obliging Staff”
Reviews.Author: pud653
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very good - although our twin room was quite small it was spotlessly clean, nice bathroom with plenty of hot water, breakfasts were simple but enough and the staff was very obliging - nothing was too much trouble. Recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Safe time with my mom”
Reviews.Author: sophisticated.k
Reviews.Content: My mom and I, we ened up staying here for 2 nights and it was wonderful! I wish that I could stay there more...There are lots of good things at the hotel sultan's eye. Most of all, the location of this hotel is excellent. It located in Sultanahmet. Especialy the fron desk staff are worderful and very pleasant! Not only him but also the owner of this hotel is extremely helpful and informative. While we were in the hotel, my mom was very happy. If you are women and first time at Istanbul, I strongly recommand this hotel. Very safe, clean (bed). The open buffet breakfast is not really great. If there are more selections, that would be better. But it is not bad

Reviews.Title: “above average 3 star in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JaneWheeler
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly and helpful man on the desk. Beds and bedding above average. Very clean and the highlight was hot water on demand which we have found unusual for Turkey pensions. Location is close to all the major sights in Istanbul. Bathrooms look like they have been renovated. Overall I would reccomend this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Sultan's Eye Comfort Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Akbiyik caddesi, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
